All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AllRounder
An Athlete subclass with no particular specialization.
Athlete
The main Athlete superclass; handles variables for all stats, names, and costs, as well as provides a static method for generating new Athletes of a random specialization (subclass).
AthleteJoins
A RandomEvent subclass handling an event in which a new randomly generated Athlete can be added to the player's team for free.
AthleteQuits
A RandomEvent subclass handing an event in which an injured (0HP) player is permanently removed from the player's team.
AthleteTest
 
Attacker
An Athlete subclass specialized in the Atk stat.
BuyButtonActionListener
 
CannotPlayMatchException
Exception thrown if a match cannot be played.
Club
The class managing the club area; here the player can view and rearrage Athletes in their team and reserve arrays, view their inventory, and use Items.
ClubGUI
GUI Class for the Club JFrame, extends the base JFrame class
ClubHouseActionListener
 
Defender
An Athlete subclass specialized in the Def stat.
EndGameScreen
End game screen class, shown at the games end, extends JFrame
Environment
The class managing the main game environment.
EnvironmentTest
 
EventTest
 
GameEnvironmentGUI
GUI Class for the main environment screen; extends JFrame.
GameSetup
An extension of the main Environment class; handles the initial game setup tasks such as setting the game difficulty and length and generating the player's initial team.
HealInjury
An Item subclass representing a "healing potion" that restores an injured (0HP) Athlete to full HP.
HealthRestore
An Item subclass representing a "first aid kit" which restores a fraction of an Athlete's depleted HP.
InteractiveItem
An abstract class defining methods for using Items that require input from the player.
InvalidNameException
Exception thrown if the player enters an invalid name.
Item
The main Item superclass; handles Item costs and generation, including a static method to generate new Items of a random type.
ItemTest
 
Match
The class that handles Sportsball matches between the player and an opposing team.
MatchActionListener
 
MatchDetailGUI
GUI Class for Match details; extends JFrame.
MatchGUI
GUI Class for the Match screen; extends JFrame.
MatchTest
 
NameGen
This class provides static methods for generating names for both Athletes and OpposingTeams by pulling from the included txt files.
NameTest
 
OpposingTeam
An extension of Team which handles generation of opposing teams for the player to compete against.
OutOfMoneyException
An exception thrown if the player is out of money and cannot make a selected purchase.
PlayerTeam
An extension of Team that handles methods and variables needed for the player's team, including their selected name, their inventory, reserve players, money, and season points.
PopUpButtonActionListerner
 
Purchasable
An interface describing methods to be implemented by objects purchasable from the shop.
PurchaseableDetailGUI
GUI Class for Athlete/Item purchase details; extends JFrame.
RandomEvent
The abstract superclass for all random events.
SellButtonActionListener
 
SetupGUI
GUI Class for initial game setup; extends JFrame.
Shop
The class which manages the shop interface; here the player can view generated Items and Athletes for sale, purchase them, or resell unwanted objects from their own roster or inventory.
ShopGUI
GUI Class for the Shop screen; extends JFrame.
ShopTest
 
SpecialTrainingGUI
GUI Class for the Special Training screen; extends JFrame.
Stadium
The main stadium class; displays the stadium menus from which the player can either play a match against an opposing team or take a bye.
StadiumJFrame
GUI Class for the Stadium screen; extends JFrame.
StadiumTest
 
StartAppGUI
GUI Class for the startup screen; extends JFrame.
StatBoost
An Item subclass representing "performance enhancing medication" which increases a selected Athlete's stats, with bonuses based on their specialization.
StatChoiceDialog
Provides a simple static method which opens a dialog allowing the user to choose which of an Athlete's stats to modify; for use with InteractiveItems.
StatIncrease
A RandomEvent subclass handling an event in which a random Athlete in the player's team receives a +5 bonus to Atk or Def.
StatReroll
An Item subclass representing a "stat reroll" which allows the player to generate a new stat value for a chosen Athlete and stat from scratch.
Team
The abstract superclass for PlayerTeam and OpposingTeam.
TeamTest
 
UseItemGUI
GUI Class for Item use; extends JDialog.
ViewDetailAction
Action Listener class for the shop GUI, Implements Java.awt.event.ActionListener
